conclusion: Determine the induced EMF in the conductor rod MN and the resulting current through the fixed resistor R.
The induced EMF in the rod is given by E = B * l * v.
The total resistance in the circuit is R_total = R + R = 2R.
The induced current I in the circuit is I = E / R_total = (B * l * v) / (2R).
The voltage U across the conductor rod MN is U = I * R = (B * l * v) / 2.
Using the right-hand rule, the induced current will flow from M to N.
The magnitude of the voltage U across MN is U = (B * l * v) / 2 and the direction of the induced current is from M to N.
